<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> Internetworking Research Project</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <H1> Internetworking Research Project</H1> Principal Investigator: <A HREF="../faculty/dec.html">Douglas E. Comer</A><P> Research Assistants: J.C. Lin, D. Stevens<P> Sponsors: AT&amp;T, Digital Equipment Corporation, Purdue Computing Center, UniForum, Intel<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> The Internetworking Research Group works actively on problems related to networking, protocol design and implementation, and distributed computing. The following lists several of the ongoing projects from the lab.we are studying in our lab: TCP Protocol Implementation, TCP Performance Measurements, Virtual Network Project, Cypress STREAMS Implementation, Simple Reliable Message Protocol, Distributed Downloading System, Multiswitch Network. As an example of our work in the Multiswitch Project, we are exploring the consequences of treating an entire Multiswitch network as a single, large, distributed "router."<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
</DOC>
